definition: to procrastinate
to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: Part of the reason I procrastinate is that I have a rich mental life.
sentences.chinese: 我這人拖拖拉拉的部分原因是我的精神生活很豐富。

sentences.english: When you find that small thing, you are no longer procrastinating .
sentences.chinese: 當你發現那是小事情時，你就不再拖拖拉拉。

sentences.english: As every procrastinator knows, the hardest step to take is the first one.
sentences.chinese: 每個拖拖拉拉的人都知道，邁出第一步是相當困難的。

sentences.english: We missed the train because you dragged your feet.
sentences.chinese: 就因爲你總是拖拖拉拉的，我們纔會誤車。

sentences.english: We promise to do something usually, but we may be dragging our feer when we are doing them.
sentences.chinese: 我們經常承諾做某事，但在幹活時卻拖拖拉拉。

sentences.english: Time boxing is good because it prevents your task from dragging on and on.
sentences.chinese: 時間限制很好，因爲它可以防止你做任務拖拖拉拉。

sentences.english: I was afraid my letters had been bogged down in beaurocratic red tape.
sentences.chinese: 我擔心我的信件已被耽擱在拖拖拉拉的公文程序中了。

definition: to dillydally/slow-going
dragging one's feet
to drag along/to haul/(fig.) to procrastinate/shilly-shallying/sluggish/(computing) drag and drop/(loanword) tola, unit of weight, approx. 11.664 grams
(dialect) to dawdle/to waste time/also written 墨跡|墨迹[mo4 ji5]
very slow
to delay/to put off/to procrastinate
dilatory/sluggish/muddled/roundabout
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
effeminate/old-womanish/garrulous/fainthearted/overly careful/overly sensitive/maudlin
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
lit. tiger's head, snake's tail (idiom); fig. a strong start but weak finish
impetuous person/excitable person
to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
to use all sorts of excuses
to rub lightly/to move slowly/to dawdle/to dillydally/to pester/to nag
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
